comment: What sets him apart is that he knows how to help students connect the concepts they learn in CS3503 with other topics, such as programming. He is super smart and master of both programming and algorithms. I highly recommend taking his course. But he is very strict with deadlines. Good luck.
He is a very smart Professor; he knows each topic well and help students to think beyond what we learn in this course. You must take CS3503 from him, very helpful for your career.
Easily approachable! He's really smart and passionate about having the students learn. This creates an atmosphere where the student does not feel judged for repeatedly asking questions.

Dr. Nguyen's mastery of the whole technical content of this course it's really a plus. You can tell from his lectures that he knows well each topic in the course, and not only follows the motions of a textbook or department slides. He is prompt to reply to his emails with student questions, and both exams although somewhat difficult, are take-home.

The class is only graded by 2 tests, a mid-term and the final both at 50% of your grade. He will give credit as long as you attempt the question and is an easy grader. The tests are take-home tests and you have a few days to complete them. He genuinely cares and wants students to learn and ask questions.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: First exam 40%, participation 10%, final exam 50% of the grade. The exams are confusing and you don't know if you passed or not until the last few hours of the semester. Very stressful, but it was a relatively easy A because of take-home exams.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 10% of your grade is participation, but he doesn't explain how that is calculated nor your final participation grade. He also calls out students who don't look focused. This wasn't a good model for me because I have attention deficits. However, He's definitely accessible outside of the classroom, so if that is important to you, he's a good choice.
A harsh grader makes sure you turn things in on time or he will fail you. His grading system is terrible he only has 2 grades for the whole semester. I don't recommend his class

Lectures are boring but if you show effort he likes to see that. He offered two different types of grading basically do the home work and test or only the test are graded. The test ended up being easier than the hw. Stay on top of the hw come to class ask questions and you'll do fine. He is extremely strict with his policies so submit on time etc.

Professor Tu taught the material in an okay way but in terms of grading he wasnt fair. He "takes attendance" but has taken it randomly 3 times and its worth 10% of your grade. The final was very difficult and so was the midterm. They were both graded harshly. He claims he wants us to learn and to be good students but I don't see that from him.

He gave us two different grading criteria: one that weighs the homework; one that does not, but weighs the tests heavier. Tests were take home and mimic what's on the homework. Extremely passionate about teaching and willing to help. Lectures can be extremely boring (really not his fault). Absolutely no late assignments - written in stone.

If you respect him and show even a modicum of effort, you'll do fine. I believe some of the less active students were graded harsher than the ones that participated in a constructive manner during class.
I think next time he will force the labs to be for a grade.
If you see "this will be on the quiz" on a slide, ask questions, it will be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He has solid knowledge on these subjects. A very nice professor.

A professor that knows their stuff, cares about students' success, and encourages you to understand the material on a deeper level. Class material is difficult but the lectures are very well put-together.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Great professor. He knows his materials well and knows how to make them clear to students.
He is very professional and nice with students. What I like most from his classes is that he always responds to emails very quick. A very supportive and friendly Professor.

I am taking the CS3503 teaching by Prof. Nguyen. You should take his courses, he is great and really cares about students' learning outcome; during classes he shares with students not only the teaching subjects but also related CS subjects, then you would gain different knowledges and skills from him.
